Title: Awujale stool: DSS summons nominees as kingmakers cancel meet-and-greet
Summary: Awujale Kingmakers’ Council has cancelled a planned meet-and-greet with nominees . Nominees were directed to report to the Department of State Services (DSS) office in Ijebu-Ode . The development was conveyed in a letter dated January 20, 2026, and addressed to the Ol

Title: Troops receive eight rescued victims, nab gunrunner in Cross River
Summary: Troops rescued eight kidnap victims and apprehended a suspected gunrunner in Cross River . Troops of 13 Brigade under 82 Division of the Nigerian Army and Joint Task Force South-East, Operation UDO KA, rescued eight victims .

Title: Breaking: Court sacks Abure, orders INEC to recognise Nenadi-led exco of LP
Summary: The Supreme Court equally dismissed a cross-appeal that was filed by Abure, even as it enjoined political parties to always abide by their own rules in appointment of their officers .

Title: Ogun govt halts Awujale selection process over petitions, security reports
Summary: The Awujale stool is one of the most revered traditional institutions in Yoruba land and a paramount stool in Ogun State . Ogun govt halts Awujales selection process over petitions, security reports .

Title: Gunman, who killed Japan ex-PM Shinzo Abe, jailed for life
Summary: The fact he "shot him from behind and did so when (Abe) was least expecting it" points to the "despicable and extremely malicious" nature of his act,' the judge said .

Title: Casualties as military sustains pressure on fleeing insurgents in Borno
Summary: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai clashed with fleeing terrorists in Borno state, resulting in the death of an unspecified number of fighters from both sides . Encounter occurred after a clearance operation conducted by the troops across terrorist locations, including Tergejeri, Chiralia, and the Ajigin/Abirma general areas .

Title: APC refutes forcing Enugu workers to register as members
Summary: The All Progressives Congress in Enugu State has denied reports that local government chairmen are coercing government workers to register or revalidate their membership with the party as a condition for receiving their salaries . The Chairman of the Caretaker Committee of the APC, Dr Ben Nwoye, dismissed the claims while speaking to journalists

Title: Japan restarts world's biggest nuclear plant
Summary: The world’s biggest nuclear power plant was restarted on Wednesday for the first time since the 2011 Fukushima disaster . The plant was “started at 19:02” (1002 GMT), Tokyo Electric Power Company spokesman Tatsuya Matoba told AFP of the Kashiwazaki-Kariwa plant in Niig

Title: FG pledges credible census, prioritises accuracy over speed
Summary: Minister of Information and National Orientation, Mohammed Idris, said accurate population data remained critical to national planning . Idris said a presidential proclamation remained legal basis for the conduct of the census, assuring that all requirements were being aligned to meet global standards .

Title: FRSC arrests fake officer over motorcycle snatching in Kano
Summary: The Federal Road Safety Corps, Kano State Sector Command, has arrested a man suspected of snatching motorcycles while impersonating a corps official in different parts of the state . The arrest was confirmed in a statement issued on Wednesday by the Sector Public Relations Officer, Abdullahi Labaran, and made available to The PUNCH .
